repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

did.unittitle: National Organization for Women Washington D.C. Chapter and Capitol Hill Chapter records
did.abstract: The material in this collection document the efforts of two chapters the Washington D.C. Chapter and the Capitol Hill Chapter of the National Organization for Women. The material in the collection dates from ca. 1971-ca. 1999.
did.physloc: Materials are stored off-site, and will require additional retrieval time. Please contact the Special Collections Research Center for more information.

arrangement.head: Collection Organization
arrangement.p: Organized into two series: Papers and Mixed Media.

bioghist.head: Historical or Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Washington, DC NOW chapter works as part of the National Organization for Women (NOW) to help all women achieve equality. NOW was founded in 1966 and as of 2007 has 550 chapters in all 50 states and the District of Columbia. The District of Columbia has a second chapter, Capitol City NOW.

NOW states its goals as working "to eliminate discrimination and harassment in the workplace, schools, the justice system, and all other sectors of society; secure abortion, birth control and reproductive rights for all women; end all forms of violence against women; eradicate racism, sexism and homophobia; and promote equality and justice in our society."

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains newsletters, correspondence, newspaper articles, reports, photographs, slides, and scanned items on a compact disc. The material covers the workings of the N.O.W. Washington D.C. Chapter and the Capitol Hill N.O.W. Chapter of the National Organization for Women and runs from 1971-99 with the bulk dates falling between ca. 1971 to ca. 1983. The newsletters are from the D.C. Chapter and run from 1971-1983, with one issue from 1999. The bulk of the material is newspaper clippings and other materials that document the work of these chapters. The newsletters include the Washington Area Women's Center newsletter titled "In Our Own Write," as well as "The Washington Equal Times," and "The National N.O.W. Times."
This collection was donated by the D.C. Chapter in 2007.

Most of the materials arrived loose and have been organized and foldered by Special Collections Research Center staff. The material listed in this guide is processed and available for use, but there is additional material in the collection that is minimally processed and may not be available for research. Please contact Special Collections for more information.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred citation
prefercite.p: National Organization for Women Washington D.C. Chapter and Capitol Hill Chapter records, Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Nancy Sahli gay rights, Capitol Hill N.O.W, and related Washingtoniana papers (MS2386) https://searcharchives.library.gwu.edu/repositories/2/resources/842

controlaccess.corpname: National Organization for Women. Washington, D.C. Chapter

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Newsletters are arranged chronologically. Clippings and other subject files are arranged by topic.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes newsletters, flyers, pamphlets, correspondence, newspaper articles, reports, and photographs. The newsletters are from the D.C. Chapter from 1971-1983, with one issue from 1999. Newsletters also include the Washington Area Women's Center newsletter "In Our Own Write," as well as "The Washington Equal Times," and "The National N.O.W. Times." Clippings files and subject files include material on reproductive rights, sex-based discrimination, affirmative action, the Equal Rights Amendment, and domestic violence, among other topics. Because much of this material was not originally foldered, folder titles were generated by Special Collections staff.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Compact disc that includes the following folders: 1. "KALINOSKI CHNOW MEMORIES": scanned Captiol Hill N.O.W. Materials, 1970-1981 2. "NOW Archives Outside Schlesinger Library": finding aid to the Janet Pierce N.O.W. collection 3. "WET ONLY": scanned copies of the Washington Equal Times, 1978-1982
